intro: Pariti virgatum, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences. Pariti virgatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
